text: is the national bicameral legislature of Japan. The National Diet Building is in Nagatachō, Chiyoda, Tokyo. It is made up of the House of Representatives (lower house) and the House of Councillors (upper house).Nussbaum, Louis- Frédéric. (2005). "History" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 333. The members of both houses of the Diet are directly elected. The Diet selects the Prime Minister. ==History== The Diet was first convened as the Imperial Diet in 1889. In 1947, the Diet took its current form.Nussbaum, at p. 335. ==Gallery== File:The Diet.jpg|Joint session of the Diet of Japan File:Japanese Houses of Parliament, 1905.jpg|Buildings housing the Diet in 1905. ==Related pages== * Bicameralism * History of Japan * National Diet Library * Parliamentary system ==References== ==Other websites== * National Diet Library website Category:1889 establishments in Asia Category:Government of Japan Japan Japan Category:1880s establishments in Japan
title: Diet of Japan
